website_summaries.verdict: A solid choice if you're looking for a one-a-day, bromelain-free quercetin supplement.
pros: Provides a full daily dosage in a single capsule, ideal if you dislike taking supplements throughout the day
Reliable quality from a reputable manufacturer
Lots of positive feedback from allergy sufferers
Suitable for those with bromelain sensitivities
cons: Some reports of messy, leaking capsules

customer_reviews.title: toxicity,magnesium sterate
customer_reviews.text: Consumers I thought this would be important to consumers. I been taking vitamins and herbs ingredients found out have magnesium stearate I had to change all my vitamins and herbs magnesium stearate It’s very bad if you take a lot of vitamins and herbs. I was disappointed just think the consumers need to know I always put organic or natural food in my body don’t want this. Hope this helps you Ines Effects of magnesium stearate Image: healthyfocus.org Magnesium Stearate Side Effects. Magnesium stearate is used as a diluting and lubricating ingredient in capsules, tablets, vitamin supplements, and baby formulas. Some of the magnesium stearate side effects are toxicity, overdose, decreased nutrient absorption, weakened immune system, and other health hazards.
customer_reviews.author: INES

customer_reviews.title: Helps teen with MCAS
customer_reviews.text: Teen daughter with MCAS uses this to help control histamine response. Helps tremendously -- especially her lungs and itchy mouth. When she knows she'll have a meal with histamine this is one of the things she takes (along with DAO enzyme, Neuro-Protek and sometimes Ketotifen).

These came highly suggested to me and now I see why. First thing in the morning I take one and it brings me great allergy relief all day no matter how bad the pollen is that day. I highly recommend this product!

customer_reviews.title: Worked!
customer_reviews.text: Worked for someone who can’t take any over the counter allergy meds. Nothing has worked for him but these work! Take as needed. You don’t just take two in the morning and you’re done. For someone with bad allergies you might need to take several times a day based on the pollen levels. Although taking it multiple times a day isn’t as convenient as once a day, for someone who hasn’t had any relief that is minor. Spring is usually miserable but now he can go outside and enjoy it. He has tried everything included bee pollen...so far this is the only thing that has helped him

It's been shown to help with sinus inflammation, and my allergies have been fine this year. It might also help fortify the gut's mucosal membrane. I've been taking 2 capsules per day.

customer_reviews.text: This is one of the few products I've found that helps with my allergies (hayfever). In order for it to reduce my allergy symptoms I have to take about 3,000 mg of it per day (6 capsules). The reason for the high dosage is that quercetin is poorly absorbed by the body. I would much rather use this though than allergy medicines that make me drowsy. Quercetin has nothing but positive side effects, including reducing photosensitivity and promoting cardiovascular health. I love this product!

It has also greatly reduced my need for asthma meds such as advair, singulaire, and a rescue inhaler.Pair this with Asthma Clear by Ridgecrest Herbals.

customer_reviews.title: Since many recommend an upper limit of 1g /day for long term ...
customer_reviews.text: If you're taking Claritin-D, Sudafed, etc daily at certain points in the year to manage allergies than this is definitely worth a look. I gave this product four stars since it hasn't totally eliminated the need for Sudafed but has reduced it by 50-75%. I have all the usual side effects from high dosages of sudafed - stomach aches, insomnia, etc so any reduction is really helpful. Since many recommend an upper limit of 1g /day for long term usage taking 1 in the morning and 1 at night during allergy season and 1 a day at other times seems reasonable to me.

I'm halfway through the bottle and haven't had a reaction to it, so that's great! I haven't yet noticed any changes due to the supplement, but I've heard it can take several months for it to start having a beneficial effect, so I'm going to give it a couple more months to kick in before I decide if it's worth it or not. Especially no negative side effects, it's worth it to me to at least keep trying this.

customer_reviews.author: daj

customer_reviews.title: Supports cardiovascular health.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to swallow. Suitable for vegetarian and vegans. I take it for it’s antioxidants. I can only think more antioxidants is better for me. I hv no way of knowing it’s efficacy. I take on recommendation of cancer experts.
customer_reviews.author: Bob W.

customer_reviews.title: What a Relief and it Really Works !
customer_reviews.text: Springtime, the start of another allergy season for me. A friend recommended Quercetin, which I purchased that day. It has been 6 months taking this supplement every evening. It took a bit over 3 days before I felt any relief, taking only 1 at bedtime. Ragweed hits in August when I needed 2 at bedtime through mid Sept. Back to one now.
customer_reviews.author: CatsCritique

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: Item as described, just started using...so no real feedback yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette

customer_reviews.title: Excellent antioxidant at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Quercentin is a good antioxidant, both for the heart and prostate. I am using it for both purposes. I like Jarrow products.
customer_reviews.author: John Boy

customer_reviews.title: I am using this for turmeric "bombs" for bioavailability. ...
customer_reviews.text: I am using this for turmeric "bombs" for bioavailability. It seems to work well. It's hard to know what exactly it is doing since you don't really "feel" it's effects.
customer_reviews.author: cdcsdc96

customer_reviews.title: Really works!
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing! Read the reviews. This stuff works to relieve allergy symptoms. reduces or eliminates my allergy symptoms with none of the 'fuzzy head' you get from Claritan, Zyrtec, etc. I've bought Quercetin from GNC and a local health store and this works as good or better and is cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: House Doctor Ray

customer_reviews.title: Worked as an antihistamine
customer_reviews.text: My dr recommended use of an antihistamine because the medication I'm on produces too many iand makes my face puffy. I had read that Quercetin works to control histamines so I have it a try. I feel that the fewer pharmaceuticals,in the body the better. The puffiness has gone down significantly so I'm very pleased. This ones a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Frieda10

customer_reviews.title: Great product that no one knows about.
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. Was having a lot of pain in my lower abdomen for years and prostate tension and it went away completely. Its really a miracle cure. Also helps with feelings of tiredness and headaches. I was lucky to find it reading an article on wikipedia one night.
customer_reviews.author: Dyom

customer_reviews.title: My Doctor recommended this...
customer_reviews.text: for my prostate issues...OMG it has really helped. I take it twice daily with a meal....I am surprisingly totally sold.
customer_reviews.author: atlcycle

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for Sinusitis
customer_reviews.text: Quercetin has been a steady help in getting my Sinusitis to clear and is also listed as a supplement which boosts the effectiveness of Green Tea in Buhner's book on "Healing Lyme Coinfections."
customer_reviews.author: windriver

product_meta.title: Jarrow Formulas Quercetin, Cardiovascular Support, 500 mg, 100 Veggie Caps
product_meta.description: Size:100 Count (Pack of 1)Quercetin is a phenolic antioxidant found in onions, green leafy vegetables and fruits such as apples and cherries. Quercetin supports cardiovascular health via its role in the inhibition of LDL oxidation.* Quercetin is one half of the rutin molecule, another phenolic antioxidant, but it is the more biologically-active antioxidant.*
feature_bullets: Quercetin is an AllerTame flavonoid, i.e., one that may promote a healthy immune response to environmental challenges.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
